intro: Aegiphila pauciflora, commonly known as the sparseflowered aegiphila, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous terrain, exhibiting a compact shrub-like form with small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually pink or violet, arranged in clusters and blooming during the spring and summer seasons. Aegiphila pauciflora is adapted to high-altitude environments, showcasing resilience to cold and low-nutrient soils.
